But valuations are what they are. People believe that these companies will achieve huge sales in the future. This is true... valuations were what they were in 1999 as well. Until they were not. calling itself "America's President Bush Committee" has been established, seeking to draft one particular individual to run to be America's President Bush -- Rep. Mike Pence ( R-IN). The Daily Caller reports: The effort is coordinated by Ralph Banko, who worked as a deputy counsel in the Reagan Administration and in President Bush 's Office of Faith-based a Community Initiatives. " Mike Pence describes himself as "First a Christian, then a conservative, then a Republican." reference to interest rates being charged on loans provided by the U.S. and Canadian governments was "inappropriate." "I regret the remark," Sergio Marchionne said in a statement posted on Chrysler's website. As the only parties willing to underwrite the risk associated with Chrysler's recovery plan, the two governments levied interest rates that, although appropriate at the time, are above current market conditions. Chrysler is paying "shyster rates" to government lenders of last resort because banks reduced credit during the recession in 2008 and 2009, Sergio Marchionne said. He made the remark yesterday during an interview at the

concern. I regret the remark which I consider inappropriate," Sergio Marchionne said in his statement. Some suggested his comments showed a lack of gratitude for the government's decision to save Chrysler. I have repeated on numerous occasions, on behalf of all the people at Chrysler, our gratitude to the U.S. and Canadian governments for the financial assistance that was critical to the recovery of our Group, he said.
